datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: utmgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: utmgrp

request.name: request
request.help: Enable/disable whether an HTTP request is passed to an ICAP server.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable HTTP request passing to ICAP server.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable HTTP request passing to ICAP server

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable HTTP request passing to ICAP server.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable HTTP request passing to ICAP server

response.name: response
response.help: Enable/disable whether an HTTP response is passed to an ICAP server.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable HTTP response passing to ICAP server.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable HTTP response passing to ICAP server

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable HTTP response passing to ICAP server.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable HTTP response passing to ICAP server

file-transfer.name: file-transfer
file-transfer.help: Configure the file transfer protocols to pass transferred files to an ICAP server as REQMOD.

options.help: Forward file transfer with SSH protocol to ICAP server for further processing.
options.label: Ssh
options.description: Forward file transfer with SSH protocol to ICAP server for further processing

options.name: ftp
options.help: Forward file transfer with FTP protocol to ICAP server for further processing.
options.label: Ftp

options.name: enable

options.label: Enable

options.name: enable

response-req-hdr.name: response-req-hdr
response-req-hdr.help: Enable/disable addition of req-hdr for ICAP response modification (respmod) processing.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not add req-hdr for response modification (respmod) processing.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Do not add req-hdr for response modification (respmod) processing

options.name: enable
options.help: Add req-hdr for response modification (respmod) processing.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Add req-hdr for response modification (respmod) processing

respmod-default-action.name: respmod-default-action
respmod-default-action.help: Default action to ICAP response modification (respmod) processing.

options.name: forward
options.help: Forward response to ICAP server unless a rule specifies not to.
options.label: Forward
options.description: Forward response to ICAP server unless a rule specifies not to

options.name: bypass
options.help: Don't forward request to ICAP server unless a rule specifies to forward the request.
options.label: Bypass
options.description: Don't forward request to ICAP server unless a rule specifies to forward the request

options.description: Disable UTM log when infection found

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable UTM log when infection found.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable UTM log when infection found

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not encapsulate chunked data.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Do not encapsulate chunked data

options.name: enable
options.help: Encapsulate chunked data into a new chunk.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Encapsulate chunked data into a new chunk

options.name: scan-progress
options.help: Support X-Scan-Progress-Interval ICAP header.
options.label: Scan Progress
options.description: Support X-Scan-Progress-Interval ICAP header

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Time (in seconds) that ICAP client waits for the response from ICAP server.

base64-encoding.name: base64-encoding
base64-encoding.help: Enable/disable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.
options.label: Disable

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.
options.label: Enable

case-sensitivity.name: case-sensitivity
case-sensitivity.help: Enable/disable case sensitivity when matching header.

options.name: disable
options.help: Ignore case when matching header.
options.label: Disable

options.name: enable
options.help: Do not ignore case when matching header.
options.label: Enable

action.name: action
action.help: Action to be taken for ICAP server.

options.name: forward
options.help: Forward request to ICAP server when this rule is matched.

options.name: bypass

options.label: Bypass
